@shaunold - It most certainly does work. You just have to be patient, as this game has some of the most atrocious initial load times known to man. It takes nearly 3-5 minutes to get to the main menu, and then it takes an additional 4-7 minutes to get into the game after selecting "New Game" or "Continue." In case you're wondering, I'm running Rogero 4.3 and the latest multiMan.

@Sphaa80 - The "BCES01584-[The Last of Us]" file is the folder you will need to move to the "GAMES" directory of your PS3's HDD. If you currently have other games backed-up there, they should have similar "BCES," "BLUS," or other prefixes.
Actually does work, no issues. Just unrar into a brand new folder, FTP everything as is and play.

slowest torrent ever. ran 30-40kbps mostly with bursts to 200. DROPPED TO 4 kbps WITH 5% REMAINING! BULLSHIT.

Alexnader78 is right. I had to FTP this huge fuckin game straight to my PS3's internal hard drive from my computer. It took forever but it's finally done and working. The file is just too big for an external hard drive. 

Also, you guys can delete the language files to help save some space when you finally get this game downloaded. Open up the following folders: BCES01584-[The Last of Us] > PS3_GAME > USRDIR > build > main > sound1 > streams > and then delete whatever languages you don't need. Deleting everything but the English language shaves off 7GB of space.

Working great on Rogero 4.40 v1.03 and multiMAN 4.40. Copied to external using Split4G. mM copied the split files to internal automatically. I had to delete the prepatched eboot.bin and use the original one (just delete eboot.bin and rename eboot_orig.bin to eboot.bin). Don't set any options in mM. Setting as Internal and turning on BD-Miirror caused black loading screen to hang when starting the game

Plays flawlessly and load times are short (~30 secs on first boot). Fantastic game! Thanks dududus!
